contentrichtext.text: {{PressCoverageYYYY}} [[Wikipedia:Press coverage]] archive for [[2001]] *[http://www.kuro5hin.org/story/2001/7/25/103136/121/ Kuro5hin] 2001/07/26 ''Britannica or Nupedia? The Future of Free Encyclopedias'' (by Wikipedia's [[Larry Sanger]]) *[[Sun Media]] syndicated "netelligence" column by Sandy McMurray (printed in the [[London Free Press]], Calgary Sun, and [[Toronto Sun]] 2001/08/15, Edmonton Sun 2001/08/16) - Referring to EB charging for its online articles, "Nupedia.com and Wikipedia.com are two growing collections of online information written by a team of volunteers." * Wales on Sunday 2001/08/26 ''Knowledge at your fingertips'' * Irish News 2001/08/27 ''The information is at your fingertips - but for a price'' *[http://www.technologyreview.com/Infotech/12586/ MIT Technology Review] 2001/09/04 ''Free the Encyclopedias!'' *[http://query.nytimes.com/gst/fullpage.html?res=9800E5D6123BF933A1575AC0A9679C8B63 New York Times] 2001/09/20 ''Fact-Driven? Collegial? This Site Wants You'' *[http://www.reveries.com/coolnews/sep_01/sep_20.html reveries.com (NYT story summarized)] *International Herald Tribune (reprint of NYT story) 2001/09/24 *[http://www.kuro5hin.org/story/2001/9/24/43858/2479 Kuro5hin] ''Wikipedia is wide open. Why is it growing so fast? Why isn't it full of nonsense?'' (by Wikipedia's Larry Sanger) *[http://www.msnbc.com/news/623905.asp?0dm=C1AMT MSNBC (reprint of Tech Review story)] *Graham Lawton, "[http://www.newscientist.com/hottopics/copyleft/copyleftart.jsp The Great Giveway]," ''NewScientist'' (British science magazine) (see also the [http://www.newscientist.com/hottopics/copyleft/forumhome.jsp associated forum] and note that ''this article is copylefted!'') *[http://opensourceschools.org/article.php?story=20011020160315930 Open Source Schools], reprinted on [http://members.iteachnet.org/webzine/article.php?story=20011113193936775 iteachnet.org] (by Wikipedia's Larry Sanger) *[http://www.topica.com/lists/suber-fos/read/message.html?mid=1605194865&sort=d&start=8 Free Online Scholarship Newsletter] *[http://opensourceschools.org/article.php?story=20011119190058114 Open Source Schools] (another column) (by Wikipedia's Larry Sanger) *[http://www.shift.com/ Shift Magazine] (mentioned in [http://www.shift.com/mag/9.6/html/9.6shiftlist.asp The Shiftlist, a regular link collection]) *[http://the.honoluluadvertiser.com/article/2001/Dec/04/tc/tc01abytemarks.html The Honolulu Advertiser] *[http://www.nytimes.com/2001/12/09/magazine/09POPULIST.html The New York Times Magazine] 2001/12/09 ''Populist editing'' *An interview about the wiki concept with [[Ward Cunningham]] by [[National Public Radio]] in the U.S. mentioned Wikipedia. The interview can be listened to (as of this writing) [http://news.mpr.org/play/ft_audio.php?media=/futuretense/daily/20011220 here]. 2001/12/20 ''future tense'' * [http://www.thirdage.com/news/archive/ALT09020115-02.html?html What Are the Busiest Web Sites?] ThirdAge , December 25, 2001, AP *[http://news.google.com/newspapers?id=zb9eAAAAIBAJ&sjid=WzEMAAAAIBAJ&pg=3129,4160196&dq=wikipedia&hl=en Internet comes of ageâ€¦and goes commercial] by Anick Jesdanun, Associated Press (picked up by numerous U.S. newspapers) December 30, 2001. *[http://www.yil.com/issues/guide.asp?volume=08&issue=02 Yahoo! Internet Life]: "Brain Waves: Works in Progress," apparently (has anyone seen it yet?) is in Volume 8, Number 2. [[Category:Wikipedia as a media topic]] [[da:Wikipedia:Presse_2001]]
